OPTIMAL.Definition: best; most likely to bring success or advantage

CAME UP.Definition: to be mentioned or talked about in conversation

CONVERSATION.Definition: (a) talk between two or more people in which thoughts, feelings, and ideas are expressed, questions are asked and answered, or news and information is exchanged

PROTONS.Definition: a type of elementary particle (= a very small piece of matter) with a positive electrical charge that is found in the nucleus of all atoms

ELECTRONS.Definition: an extremely small piece of matter with a negative electrical charge

MEMORIZE.Definition: to learn something so that you will remember it exactly

OFFICIALLY.Definition: as stated or accepted by people publicly but not privately or as things really are

FLUENT.Definition: when a person is fluent, they can speak a language easily, well, and quickly

GETTING OUT OF THEIR OWN WAY.Definition: to make a special effort to do something

ASSET.Definition: a useful or valuable quality, skill, or person

POSSESS.Definition: to have or own something, or to have a particular quality

EXAGGERATING.Definition: to make something seem larger, more important, better, or worse than it really is

SUPPOSED.Definition: to think that something is likely to be true

ROMANTIC.Definition: relating to love or a close loving relationship

SUCKS.Definition: if someone or something sucks, that person or thing is bad or unpleasant

HARSH.Definition: unpleasant, unkind, cruel, or more severe than is necessary

TRIAL AND ERROR.Definition: a way of achieving an aim or solving a problem by trying a number of different methods and learning from the mistakes that you make

OBTAINED.Definition: to gain or attain usually by planned action or effort

PASSIVELY.Definition: not acting to influence or change a situation; allowing other people to be in control

LUXURY.Definition: something expensive that is pleasant to have but is not necessary

FUCKED.Definition: in a very bad or difficult situation

SACRIFICE.Definition: to give up something for something else considered more important

GRATIFICATION.Definition: pleasure or satisfaction, or something which provides this

INVEST.Definition: to put money, effort, time, etc. into something to make a profit or get an advantage

TAKE ADVANTAGE OF.Definition: to use an opportunity to achieve results, sometimes in an unfair way

MAKE EXCUSES.Definition: to give false reasons why you cannot do something

AFFORD.Definition: to have enough money or time to buy, keep, or do something

BULLSHIT.Definition: complete nonsense or something that is not true

ACCESS.Definition: the right or ability to look at documents and information

PRACTICAL.Definition: suitable for the situation in which something is used

SHORTCUTS.Definition: a quicker way of doing something in order to save time or effort

NECESSARY.Definition: needed in order to achieve a particular result

MAGICALLY.Definition: produced by or as if by magic

DETERMINE.Definition: to find out or come to a decision about by investigation, reasoning, or calculation

PRIORITY.Definition: something that is very important and must be dealt with before other things

INTENTION.Definition: something that you want and plan to do; an aim

ON SOME REAL SHIT.Definition: a phrase usually used to signify a very serious comment

Y'ALL.Definition: you-all; used to address a group of people that you are speaking to

ATTENTIVELY.Definition: in a way that is attentive (= listening carefully or giving careful attention)

UNDERRATED.Definition: better or more important than most people believe

PATTERN.Definition: a particular way in which something is done, is organized, or happens

RECOGNITION.Definition: the fact of knowing someone or something because you have seen or heard him or her or experienced it before

DERIVE.Definition: to get something from something else

WALK OF LIFE.Definition: referring to different types of jobs and different levels of society

SOLELY.Definition: only and not involving anyone or anything else

FOR THE SAKE OF.Definition: because of, or for the purpose of something

POOR.Definition: to have very little of a particular substance or quality

CONTEXT.Definition: the situation within which something exists or happens, and that can help explain it

INFER.Definition: to form an opinion or guess that something is true because of the information that you have

ROLE.Definition: a function or part performed especially in a particular operation or process

PLAYS.Definition: to influence or have an effect on

ENCOURAGE.Definition: to talk or behave in a way that gives someone confidence to do something

INTERNALIZE.Definition: to accept or absorb an idea, opinion, belief, etc. so that it becomes part of your character

RICHER.Definition: having or containing a large amount of something desirable or valuable

INTEREST.Definition: something that brings advantages to or affects someone or something

CURIOSITY.Definition: an eager wish to know or learn about something
